results.title: The Wonderful world of dogs
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission, Channel 4 and Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: 540,000 dogs inhabit the city of Sydney and every one with a story to tell. This whimsical, humorous film tells some of them, and in particular, the story of Fugly, the most impounded dog in Australia, and his impact on the suburb of Mosman. Dog lovers and dog haters alike express their point of view as we watch Fugly roaming the streets. “Some dogs just want to be dogs. Some people want dogs to be people. But dogs will be dogs … and people will be people. We all live together.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Lewis, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission, Channel 4 and Radio Pictures

results.title: Tuktu and the trials of strength
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Strong and hardy Inuit hunters demonstrate and test their strength in boxing, tug-of-war, and other strenuous activities. We see and hear the drum dance, a demonstration of Inuit poetry and rhythm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the clever hands
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A general look at some of the things made by the Inuit and a commentary on the clever use that they make of the few materials that are available in their harsh environment. We come to the conclusion that they are highly skilled, overcoming problems that to us would seem almost insurmountable.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the big kayak
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu impatiently watches his father and the kayak man build a kayak. He longs to cut wood and use the bow drill, but is told to watch and learn. In the end the boat is finished, and Tuktu goes for a ride in it with his father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the indoor games
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A happy, joyous look at the Inuit and the games they play in the big igloo. Outside, the wind and blizzard howl, but Tuktu’s family and friends ignore the weather. They juggle stones, skip and play with a delightful Inuit child. Finally Tuktu falls asleep and dreams about the good time he has had.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the caribou hunt
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
When the caribou cross the small lakes to reach new grazing ground, the Inuit hunt the animals from their kayaks. Tuktu’s father has bad luck with his hunting and a caribou escapes his spear. But we see him bringing one home, and the film ends with an outdoor fire and everyone enjoying a feast.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the snow palace
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
After a trek to new hunting grounds, Tuktu’s family and friends build igloos, in particular a giant igloo where feasting, dancing and games take place. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and his animal friends
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
In this film we look at the smaller animals that live in the Arctic, including lemmings, weasels, ducks and kittiwakes. It also includes material on flowers. Tuktu’s father climbs the high cliffs in search of gulls’ eggs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the magic spear
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu accompanies his family when fishing is done through the ice during the long cold winter. He also sees his father catch fish with a spear during the summer, Tuktu longs to grow up and spear fish too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: You can't grow potatoes up there
results.creator_credit: Peter Crass and North West Territories Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of seal hunting in the traditional life of the Inuit Eskimo of Canada’s Arctic. Made on location with three groups of Inuit hunters, the films hows how their traditional existence has become dangerously threatened by anti-sealing publicity. Hunters show the different techniques used to hunt seal year round; the use that is made of the meat; and how the skins are prepared for sale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Crass and North West Territories Information
results.description: Illustrates the importance of seal hunting in the traditional life of the Inuit Eskimo of Canada’s Arctic. Made on location with three groups of Inuit hunters, the films hows how their traditional existence has become dangerously threatened by anti-sealing publicity. Hunters show the different techniques used to hunt seal year round; the use that is made of the meat; and how the skins are prepared for sale.
